result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin Christopher Crumwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin Christopher Crumwell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devin Christopher Crumwell in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Devin Christopher Crumwell.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 3. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2. 

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No contact with victim unless the victim consents and is approved by the agent.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- DV assessment imposed, as to both counts.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 41.

Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devin Christopher Crumwell in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Devin Christopher Crumwell in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devin Christopher Crumwell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).    Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
